title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Canterbury Farm in Becket, Massachusetts, closed after 40 years, as owners Linda and Dave Bacon retire.
The 200-acre property offered cross-country skiing, hiking, and community events in the Berkshires.
Challenges included less snow due to climate change and increased competition from 150 local Airbnb establishments.

title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Patriots Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss ruled out for Sunday's game against Buccaneers due to injuries.
Rookie TreVeyon Henderson and veteran Terrell Jennings expected to cover running workload in Stevenson's absence.
With Elliss and Boutte out, Stefon Diggs and others to lead Patriots' offense and defense against NFC South leaders.

title: Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do.
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye statistically ranks among the NFL's top quarterbacks, contributing to the Patriots' 7-2 start this season.
Maye received minimal support in an MVP vote by NFL executives, with just one vote compared to Matthew Stafford's 13.
Analysts like Nate Tice and Dan Orlovsky consider Maye an MVP candidate, citing his performance despite limited offensive help.

title: Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader recommendations for the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston, inviting suggestions for standard or unique versions.
Espresso martinis, popular in Boston, feature on nearly every bar menu with variations like coconut or burnt sugar added.
Responses may be featured in a future guide; readers can submit via form or email for potential inclusion.

title: Travelers face delays, cancellations at Logan Airport after FAA names it among airports impacted by the shutdown
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport sees delays and cancellations due to a 10% air traffic reduction from the FAA amid shutdown.
By 2 p.m. Friday, there were 107 delays and 38 cancellations at Logan Airport, according to FlightAware.
Massport advises passengers to check flight statuses, urging those traveling to prepare for potential disruptions.

title: 10 noteworthy stats after a month of hockey for 2025-26 Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins improved to 6-1 in their last seven games, tightening their defensive play under coach Marco Sturm.
Hampus Lindholm's return has bolstered Boston's penalty kill to 96.6% in games he's played versus 70.9% without him.
The Bruins' goalies hold a combined 1.8 goals saved above expected this season, with room for improvement noted.

title: More Massachusetts residents say their finances are in poor shape, UMass poll finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass/WCVB poll shows financial confidence in Massachusetts at lowest since 2021, with 21% rating finances as 'poor'.
Poll highlights rising concerns about housing, economy, and cost of living as key issues for Massachusetts residents.
Survey reveals strong support for cellphone restrictions in K-12 schools and maintaining the state's current flag.

title: Fitchburg police defend actions during ICE arrest after man appears to seize while holding child
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Fitchburg police assisted ICE during a tense arrest of Juliana Milena Ojeda-Montoya, reportedly a violent criminal, on Kimball Street.
Ojeda-Montoya's husband appeared to suffer a seizure while holding their child; emergency personnel found no medical issue.
ICE agents requested police backup as a crowd gathered; a portion of Kimball Street was temporarily closed for safety.

title: Review & setlist: At the Shubert, Robert Plant’s quest to keep evolving was on full display
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Robert Plant performed at the Shubert Theatre with 'Saving Grace featuring Suzi Dian,' exploring pan-global omni-folk music.
The concert included a mix of Led Zeppelin classics, covers, and new music from Plant's latest collaboration.
Plant shared the stage with Suzi Dian, highlighting their vocal harmonies and independent projects from past collaborations.

title: Are AI hiring tools to blame for job seekers being ghosted? Experts say itâ€™s more complicated.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Job seekers in Greater Boston report frequent ghosting, attributing it to AI tools used in recruitment processes.
Recruiters argue while AI systems filter candidates, the oversaturated job market is a significant factor in application ghosting.
Experts caution against over-optimizing resumes for AI, emphasizing the importance of human-focused applications amidst hiring slowdowns.
